greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes between successive semiprimes.
comment: a(n) = 0 for almost all n. The average order of a(n) is 1/log log n. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Apr 29 2012
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime Counting Function
example: a(34)=3, as there are three primes between A001358(34)=19*5=95
xref: Cf. A214520 (primes that are the only prime between consecutive semiprimes).
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 08 2003
